0.title: 100 Days in Europe
0.notes: I read this after finishing Hans and Emily. I see that the author likes European aesthetics. This feels a bit like those old shojo series about what is perceived as European - but somehow in a modern setting.

1.title: 10th - You and I Fell in Love with the Same Person
1.notes: I saw this at the bookstores, and wondered about it. Turns out it's only 3 volumes, and since it's published here, it can't be bad, right, I thought. So I picked it up. It's quite interesting, I suppose, since in the end, they all stayed friends.

2.title: 150 Days
2.notes: I read this because the art looked cute

4.title: 19 Days
4.notes: Originaly recommended by Hattchan! A very nice BL series, and Old Xian's artwork is a treat to the eyes.

8.title: 3 AM Dangerous Zone
8.notes: I read this on Putri's recommendation.

10.title: 600 Page Mystery
10.notes: I read this because this was short and was recommended as being similar to series recommended by Hattchan. A recommendation of a recommendation, I suppose.

11.title: 87 Clockers
11.notes: I read this because I wanted to read something else from Ninomiya. It's not quite as enjoyable as Nodame, but it also has quirky casts.

12.title: A Beer in Loire
12.notes: I listened to this audiobook because Jay Foreman from Map Men reads it! It turned out to be quite interesting and funny, even if I don't like beer.

13.title: A Depiction of Hell
13.notes: This has such pretty art, but also it is pretty messed up. I look at this and I still remember how unsettling the story was, even if I don't remember what the story was about.

15.title: A Girl by the Sea
15.notes: I saw this in a bookshop and wanted to buy it but never did. This and Oyasumi Punpun is probably how I first hear about [[Asano Inio]]

16.title: A Mangaka at the Night Before the Deadline
16.notes: I surprisingly randomly found this on a scanlator group's page, via Tachiyomi, haha. Viva Tachiyomi! Hachirumi is actually translating stuff (mostly oneshots) with approval from the authors, so tha's pretty cool!

17.title: A Personal Matter
17.notes: I borrowed this from Vitaly. He had to read this for an assignment in uni, but I read it just for fun. It feels a bit bleak at first but somehow it kinda had a good ending.

18.title: A River in Darkness
18.notes: A story of the lengths one had to go through to stay alive in extreme conditions. Sad, but hopeful since you know that he made it, and lived to write the tale.

20.title: A Witch's Printing Office
20.notes: A funny fantasy comic about Comicket, otaku, and the doujin scene. Seems like Mochinchi is originally a doujin author on Comicket as well. I wanna go there too once!

21.title: Adekan
21.notes: I dropped this because the scanlators stopped translating

23.title: Alice 19th
23.notes: I found a volume of this somewhere in Balikpapan, maybe it was my aunt's.

25.title: Amina and the Magic Lamp
25.notes: Recommended by Putri, who reads on Manta.

27.title: Annarasumanara
27.notes: This series is so beautifuly drawn. I started reading webtoons because of this. I read it back when I started living alone in Schriesheim.

28.title: Arakure
28.notes: I found this through the Indonesian manga magazine HanaLala. I picked it up again years after, but picking up these comics after so many years is quite fun.

29.title: Are You Going to Eat?
29.notes: Very cute comic - there's a mobile app based on this comic. I played it for a while, but then lost all my progress TUT

30.title: Arok Dedes
30.notes: I really liked this book. It showed a very interesting political perspective of the Ken Arok legend, and how at the end of the day, Dedes also lost.

31.title: As I Lay Dying
31.notes: I read this the summer after 12th grade for fun. Mrs. Rizzardi mentioned that this is an interesting piece of literature. I kinda agree, but it's so bleak.

32.title: Ascendance of a Bookworm- Part 1
32.notes: Recommended by Hattchan. I'm currently reading the sequel [31.03.2021]

33.title: Assasination Classroom
33.notes: I started reading this because of Hattchan

36.title: Ayako
36.notes: The story is rather dark... It's not a story you read when you're feeling down.

39.title: Balada Akhir Pekan
39.notes: I somehow found this hilarious, haha.

40.title: Barakamon
40.notes: I first saw this in a bookshop at a train station. I was intrigued by the premise of a manga revolving caligraphy.

42.title: Beastars
42.notes: I binged this on a hot Saturday instead of studying for my exams. Putri recommended the anime to me. I think I'm very similar to Legosi because I also think Louis is the coolest character.

43.title: Beauty is the Beast
43.notes: I first read this on HanaLala

44.title: Beauty
44.notes: I read the ebook version of this using the last days of my Scribd subscription. The story is not bad and include several themes. I like that the story has a fairytale-cautionary tale aesthetics to it.

46.title: Beneath the Clouds
46.notes: I found this through another webcomic called Realm if Owls, through which I found the SpiderForest webcomic collective, through which I found Beneath the Clouds. I liked the story and artstyle.

48.title: Beyond Valhalla
48.notes: I bought the PDF on Gumroad, I think? But it's not available anywhere anymore it seems?

49.title: Black Cat
49.notes: One of the series that brought Hattchan and I together

52.title: Blood Alone
52.notes: Apparently this series was dropped but the author decided to continue the series independently? I'm too impatient to continue reading this, but I guess the two main characters are kinda interesting. Feels a bit like Gunslinger Girl, but with more slice-of-life element.

53.title: Blood+
53.notes: Hattchan and I argued about who is more pitiful, Saya or Diva back in the day.

55.title: Boku-tachi wa Mada Aoku
55.notes: I read this because it's highest rating manga on MangaUpdates published in 2021. It's pretty cute.

56.title: Bokura ga Ita
56.notes: A sad story - when everything finally works out, it stops working until the very end and it's all quite sad 😢

57.title: Born a Crime
57.notes: I really like this book. Noah's story telling is a treat.

58.title: Brave New World
58.notes: I read this in AP Literature

59.title: Buddha
59.notes: Should read if you like manga/graphic novels, I think.

61.title: Byte-Sized Insights
61.notes: I like this kind of informative comics - this style is similar to what I liked to read in my childhood.

63.title: Cat Funeral
63.notes: I read this officially on Tapas

64.title: Cats of the Louvre
64.notes: A melancholic, whimsical growing-up story about people who are lost in paintings

65.title: Celestial Bodies
65.notes: I wanted to read something from an Omani author! It's kinda sad, actually. It really captures the rapidly changing society.

67.title: Cermin Putih
67.notes: One of the comics I bought when Koloni comics began publishing local works. Overall, it's my favorite from all the Koloni comics I got.

68.title: Chainsaw Man
68.notes: I like this more than [[Fujimoto Tatsuki#Fire Punch]]. This series has an anime, and is probably the most successfull series by Fujimoto. It's definitely fast-paced and refreshing in the shounen genre. I think it is getting a sequel?

69.title: Charlotte's Letter
69.notes: I think I started binging a bunch of these 18th century maid-themed webtoons at some point. These include [[Getting to Know Grace]] and [[Ghosts of Greywoods]]. Charlotte's Letter is my favorite, though.

71.title: Chisoni
71.notes: I got this book in Cape Town, as it seems to be hard to find outside of Africa. An interesting book, and I also wanted to finish this during my long flight to and from Cape Town.

73.title: Coffee Mou Ippai
73.notes: I found this on the shelf of a comic shop in Malmö, Sweden. It was the Swedish edition, so I didn't get it, but the unique art style made it memorable. Only 3 volumes (or less) have been scanlated, so I hope I find volume 4 and 5 in a language I can read someday.

79.title: Danza
79.notes: I wanted to read this because the art style looks unique, and it had decent ratings. It wasn't too bad.

81.title: Daybreak
81.notes: This short story was created for a contest with a killing deadline, but we hope it's still enjoyable to read.

82.title: Days of Hana
82.notes: Similar to Orange Marmalade, there's a theme of discrimination in Days of Hana. However, this story took a more tragic end, in which the protagonist dies and oppression kinda continues. I thought it will finally have a happier end, but alas....

89.title: Der Gast im Garten
89.notes: I got this book because of the pretty illustrations and because it was on sale

90.title: Descending Stories
90.notes: I really lliked the story. I liked that the story really uses rakugo as a literary device. I'm currently also reading another rakugo manga, but that one feels more light, shounen style, whereas this is more of a seinen style manga, that ends with the story "The God of Death".

91.title: Detroit Metal City
91.notes: I actually watched the movie based on this first before reading the comic. The actor for L in the Death Note live action played the main character in DMC live action.

92.title: Devine Damnation
92.notes: Seems like the series got dropped, sadly

93.title: Die Häschenschule
93.notes: Taly read this for me when I was learning German. It's very cute.

94.title: Dissolving Series
94.notes: I bought this volume as part of Humble Bundle's manga bundle. I wanted to read more of Junji Ito's works, but after this I got really scared ._.

97.title: Doranote
97.notes: Funny and unexpected crossover of Death Note and Doraemon, hih.

98.title: Dramacon
98.notes: I borrowed this from TAISM's library, but I didn't read the last volume

99.title: Duty After School
99.notes: My second series form Ha Il-Kwon after Annarasumanara. His series after this is called [Spearman](https://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=133790), which was too porn-ish for me to read it... He has two more series out since this one ([Taste of Illness](https://www.webtoons.com/en/drama/taste-of-illness/list?title_no=2506) is even translated to English officially on Webtoons.), perhaps I'll pick it up.

100.title: Earth Recording 0001
100.notes: Another oneshot I found on Hachirumi.I quite like it.

101.title: Edith
101.notes:
The story was OK. I liked that all the main characters had some growth. It's not really the kind of stories I like, but it's not a bad story.

I've heard from Reddit that the ending was rather rushed. I agree that the ending was written rather strangely - somehow everything that was building up just comes flat in the end.

106.title: Eureka 7
106.notes:
I love Anemone from this series! Her character growth is so good!
I also like the artist duo - I continued to read their next series, Deadman Wonderland.

108.title: Familyman
108.notes: I binged this in an evening and a morning. I had no class that morning, it was the last weekday before winter break. It was really touching. I was reading this instead of packing.

110.title: Fire Punch
110.notes: This is just so messed up. I binged it during Christmas break and somehow characters you begin to like just die. The main character kinda lost himself, and he's just so transfixed with his sister it's borderline creepy (which I think was also somewhat addressed?) It has the explosiveness of [[Fujimoto Tatsuki#Chainsaw Man]] but not as refined and more convoluted.

114.title: Freeter ga Jimini Isekai Teni Suru Manga

115.title: Fullmetal Alchemist
115.notes: I read this masterpiece - finally! It was all the rage back in 2010-2012, I think, but it was too popular back then, and I prefer waiting a bit and binging a series in the end of the day, after all. I also really wanted to read this because of Genshin's 2.3 Albedo event.

118.title: Garudayana
118.notes: I read this on CIAYO before the platform collapsed. This comic was really advertised as the breakthrough Indonesian comic in the 2010s until the webtoon format begin to dominate. Seems like the comic is on forever hiatus, since Yuniarto is busy with his other projects.

119.title: Getting to Know Grace
119.notes: I think I started binging a bunch of these 18th century maid-themed webtoons at some point. These include [[Ghosts of Greywoods]]and [[Charlotte's Letter]], the later being my favorite of them all.

121.title: Ghost Wife
121.notes: I surprisingly like this, even though it's creepy. The art really emphasize the creepyness of things.

122.title: Ghost's Dilemma
122.notes: I read this while in the mood of ghost-themed stories like [[Kennsaty#Blue]]. This was better and sadder than I expected when I picked up the series.

123.title: Ghostly Buddie
123.notes: The second comic by Chi Choi that I read. It is in black and white, seems to be an older comic of Chi  Choi.

124.title: Ghosts of Greywoods
124.notes: I think I started binging a bunch of these 18th century maid-themed webtoons at some point. These include [[Seorim, Mokma#Getting to Know Grace]] and [[Kkomak#Charlotte's Letter]], the later being my favorite of them all.

125.title: Girls of the Wild
125.notes: It was quite interesting thing the beginning, but I lost interest in the end, really.

132.title: Half-Ghost
132.notes: Woo, another series that is similar in premise, but different enough, and also still pretty well-received. Saejung found his niche!

133.title: Handa-Kun
133.notes: I just wanted to read something from Yoshino Satsuki after Barakamon.

135.title: Harfang
135.notes: I saw this online in Oman somehow, and then I got the German version when I could :)

136.title: Haritoge Kuremi to Ou no Ie

137.title: Haroun and the Sea of Stories

139.title: Hearts for Sale
139.notes: Seems to be Miyuli's breakthrough work.

140.title: Heimat
140.notes: A sad memoir about the after-effects of war for the generations after the war. This book shows the German guilt because of World War 2. However, it is a little outdated, Vitaly said. Germany has moved on some more from this German guilt. Perhaps the current war in Ukraine also shows that Germany is moving on fron World War 2.

142.title: Her Secret!
142.notes: Currently reading this - another great series from Gi Meng-Gi!

143.title: Heroes
143.notes: I got this for free from the free Audible trial

145.title: Hetalia dj - Aru Otoko no Haiboku
145.notes: I really like this doujin! Really one of my favorites

146.title: Himawari House
146.notes: I thought the premise of this (living abroad while going to a language school) is similar to what I experienced, which is why I picked it up. I also like that multiple languages are used in the book, despite it being in English. That being said, I felt that the book may be fantasizing the birth country a bit too much. Maybe the Japanese-American girl is too naive, but if you move out of your birth country at some point, parts of that country will probably become foreign to you as time changes everything.

148.title: Hingga Usai Usia
148.notes: This used to be serialized in Ciayo with strips also published on Instagram. Sadly, Ciayo shut down, and now it is only being published on Instagram, and no longer as active. Also available in print (self-published).

150.title: Homegrown
150.notes: Not as a fluffy and cute as it looks.

152.title: Horimiya
152.notes: Hattchan recommended this to me, and I really liked it!

153.title: Houseki no Kuni
153.notes: Seems to have plenty of Buddhist (or Shinto?) references.

157.title: I Sold Off My Lifespan, for 10,000 Yen a Year

158.title: Imouto no Ane
158.notes: The full on nudity and the whole story is pretty funny, but also cool at the same time. This is probably my second best favorite after Look Back.

162.title: Invitation to Mystic Messenger
162.notes: I only read this because I played through Mystic Messenger once. I read the Indonesian translation on Webtoon. The English translation is on TappyToon, which I do not use.

163.title: Iron Lungs
163.notes: Also uploaded to MangaDex by the author.

167.title: Jibun Kaigi
167.notes: I read this because of  Eve's song with the same name.

168.title: JOYful Delightc
168.notes: I liked the story since it's a sequel of [[Chairunnisa#Matahari 1-2 Lingkaran]]. I also liked that it portrayed LDR across countries, which felt close to my own experiences. However, it was a little outrageous to claim that Turkish food is somehow less salty than Indonesian food! It made me want to eat Turkish food - Taly and I went out to Alte Gundtei after I read this bit. The ending felt a teensy little bit rushed.

176.title: Karaoke Ikko!
176.notes: I bought this with my own money! I've been wanting to read more of Wayama Yama's work since his previous work [[Muchuu sa, Kimi ni]]. It did not disappoint.

180.title: Kimetsu no Yaiba Dj. The Kochou-Tomioka Family

182.title: Kimi ni Todoke
182.notes: I used to not like this in high school because it felt like some characters are just going around and around in their heads. I can appreciate it more now, though. It feels similar to [[Ichigo Takano#Orange]], but without the whole supernatural aspect of receiving letters from your future self.

188.title: Koi wo Shiranai Bokutachi wa
188.notes: I read this because of Rainbow Days! I really like this author's works. It feels like a shoujo manga, but not too cringy.

189.title: Koji Koi
189.notes: Cute, short.  I read it because the scan group also scanlated [[Minami Mizuno#Koi wo Shiranai Bokutachi wa]] and Mizuno's new series [[Minami Mizuno#Hiiragi-senpai to Ofutari-sama]]

193.title: Kutu Webtoon
193.notes: This was cute and short - sad that it felt a bit rushed in the end.

194.title: Laras(h)ati
194.notes: I read the sequel first before I picked this up.

198.title: Lonely Professor and Robot Girl's Despair-Like Utopia
198.notes: I read this because I wanted more of [[Yamada Kanehito#Souso no Frieren]]. I'm happy Yamada isn't drawing for Souso no Frieren though, haha.

199.title: Look Back
199.notes: This is what got me into Fujimoto's work to begin with. This oneshot is just so good. It's slice of life, but not missing the explosiveness of Fujimoto's work in the end.

200.title: Looking for Clotho
200.notes: Similar in theme to [[Taguchi Shouichi, Miaki Sugari#I Sold Off My Lifespan for 10 000 Yen a Year]], but not as heart-warming and romance-ish. It's darker and ends in the main characters dying, more like in Persona 3.

201.title: Lore Olympus
201.notes: I dropped this series after the recent plot twist that Ares also likes Persephone and that ruining his relationship with Aphrodite. Somehow became the top webtoon on Webtoon.

202.title: Love Advice from the Great Dukes of Hell
202.notes: I love this - this was hilarious. 2024 and I'm still waiting for new works from this author.

203.title: Love Calendar
203.notes: It was nice to read this after listening to the songs all through high school.

207.title: Magi no Okurimono
207.notes: I saw this pretty cover in the front page of MangaDex, saw it had decent ratings and is already completed, so I went ahead and read it. The story is pretty bittersweet.

208.title: Marble
208.notes: I missed Zelkats' works. Can't believe it's been 12 years since this was released (2024)

214.title: Migi & Dali
214.notes: Another great series from Sano! I love the characters, the growth, everything! I like the whole American gothic feel of this.

217.title: Mistake
217.notes: This comic is somehow a mistake. I regret having hopes about reading it...

219.title: Moon Land
219.notes: I read it because it's fully available for free on Manga Plus. Turns out it's a comic about gymnastics!

222.title: Muchuu sa, Kimi ni
222.notes: The art is really pretty - it made me a fan of this mangaka. I found this randomly on mangaupdates.

223.title: Mustard Chocolate
223.notes: I found this somehow through [[Yamakawa Naoto#Coffee Mou Ippai]], I think. Or maybe it was through [[!--Oneshots-1 (16)#Danza]]. I'm not sure, but the artstyle is unique. I think the story is so-so. I do like that in the end, as far as I remember, they could all be friends/friendly with one another.

224.title: My Beloved Emperor
224.notes: I thought the story is quite unique because I never read a Vietnamese work before this. I should read more of this artist's works!

225.title: My Boo
225.notes: Although the premise is quite interesting, and since I liked Kennsaty's Blue, which in kinda similar, I did not like the weird sexual tension between the two main characters.

226.title: My ID is Gangnam Beauty
226.notes: This author's art has gotten soo much better!

227.title: My Maria
227.notes: I waited for for my free chapters on this comic, but it seemed to have been removed from the platform (Tapas)

228.title: Mystery for My Dear A
228.notes: Recommended by Hattchan! Sadly the last chapter is not scanlated ((

232.title: Nana
232.notes: I'm still sad that this was dropped because Yazawa got too sick. Oh well, it's still in my heart. I honestly liked ParaKiss more than Nana. Nana is too much drama for me.

233.title: Nanase-kun no Tenshoku
233.notes: I found this author's oneshots on MangaDex randomly, and I love them all. This one though, might be my favorite. There is one more called [[Akagi Shun#One-Armed Amy]] that I haven't read yet.

234.title: Nano List
234.notes: Min is definitely good at drawing pretty girls.

236.title: Navillera
236.notes: I can't believe this was written by the same guy who wrote [[Hun#Girls of the Wild]]! I saw this on Tapas, and I love this so much. A lot of the series on Tapas feel a bit same-ish, so something unique like this really stands out.

238.title: Neko no Otera no Chion-san
238.notes: I don't remember how I found this comic - probably through browsing MangaDex. It's a nice slice-of-life, I guess. I really enjoy looking at the cats. Sometimes it has a "find the cats in this panel" quiz, hihi.

241.title: Nice to Meet You
241.notes: I first saw this in Tapas and thought that the art was cute. Now that this is finished, the story is very much so-so.

244.title: Ningyo Rhapsody
244.notes: I started looking for other Fujimoto oneshots after [[Fujimoto Tatsuki#Look Back]]

245.title: No One Will Say the Name of that Country

248.title: Olive Kitteridge
248.notes: I borrowed this from Mrs. Rizzardi. I don't quite remember the context, though.

249.title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

253.title: Only Human
253.notes: This seems to be dropped. The author has a new series

254.title: Ootani-san Chi no Tenshi-sama
254.notes: Kinda blasphemous, not really that funny, but OK.

256.title: Orange
256.notes: This is a really nice shoujo series. I remember this being hyped up back in 2014, maybe? I saw an ad for it on a magazine/another comic series in Indonesia.

257.title: Otaku ni Koi wa Muzukashii
257.notes: Really funny and relatable, I hope I can draw comics on the side like Narumi.

258.title: Other Minds- The Octopus, the Sea, and the Deep Origins of Consciousness

260.title: Our Time
260.notes: Interesting time travel story, but also feels so short.

266.title: Pandora's Choice
266.notes: I wanted to read this since the author's previous work on Tapas seemed to have gotten axed. The story is quite interesting, as well as the author's portrayal of presumably East Asians (darker skin than the usual portrayal especially in K-Pop, flat nose, thick lips). The tone of this particular series seem to be similar to other feminist Korean comics.

267.title: Paradise Kiss
267.notes: When I read this in 6th grade, this was really cool, sexy, and fashionable.

271.title: Phallaina
271.authors: Marietta Ren  Small Bang Studio, Small Bang Studio,Marietta Ren
271.notes: A super cool app idea! The comic was just as intereting. But one of the reasons to read this is definitely the format. It's like the webtoon scrolling format, but horizontal, instead of vertical. Funny how we return to the scrolling format after moving to the paged format.

272.title: Pilkadew
272.notes: Was published on CIAYO. I downloaded it on Tachiyomi before CIAYO closed down.

276.title: Platinum End
276.notes: Not as good as Death Note

279.title: Pupus Putus Sekolah
279.notes: Pupus Putus Sekolah was originally an entry for a contest on Webtoon, but didn't win. I thought this would be the end of the series, but to my suprise, the series was picked up and got serialized after the contest!

281.title: Rainbow Days
281.notes: I wanted to read this eversince I saw it at the bookshops. Turns out Hattchan's read it too! I really like this series, and how the authors write stories!

284.title: Ran and the Grey World
284.notes: I liked this and the magic in it. Low-key reminds me of  CLAMP's works

285.title: Raruurien
285.notes: Seems to be in forever hiatus at this point

289.title: Restart wa Tadaima no Ato de
289.notes: Basically BL combined with rural life - a bunch of fluffy stuff. I couldn't handle just seeing this in book stores so I went and read it.

291.title: Running Girl
291.notes: I saw this on Reprodukt and it looked interesting. The story is actually pretty sad.

292.title: Running Gun Rubia
292.notes: Won horobale mention of Jump's Tezuka Manga Contes 100th Anniversary. It was so-so.

294.title: Sailor Suit is Dyed in Black

295.title: Sakamichi no Apollon
295.notes: I began watching the anime with Duc while Putri was studying. I didn't finish it because somehow I didn't feel like it anymore...

298.title: Samenai Machi no Kissaten
298.notes: The dreamy feeling of this comic reminds me of this song

299.title: Sayonara Eri
299.notes: As with any other Fujimoto works, this was really hyped, and I enjoyed it too.

300.title: Sayonara, Manga
300.notes: It's a good series, but it was cut short - the ending felt rushed. Maybe it was cancelled (

305.title: Shadow Beauty
305.notes: Recommended by Putri. The whole series was free to read for a limited time, so I binged it in a day. I like that all characters have a problem, even though that's also pretty sad.

306.title: Shall We Poledance
306.notes: This was quite interesting. It felt short, but the story has a decent structure. The insights into pole-dancing is also pretty interesting. Of course 'Korean-comic feminism' is in this, but the tone of this is not as bad/negative as others.

308.title: ShibaO
308.notes: I got the second volume of this as a freebie from a magazine in Indonesia.

309.title: Shin Angyo Onshi
309.notes: I remember I binged on this one night and it was really cool. By the time I was done, the sun was rising and I had to go to school...

310.title: Shinbunbu no Komatsu-san
310.notes: I just started reading other works by Mizuno because I really like her works.

313.title: Shinya Shokudou
313.notes: There's a netflix series of this, and it's better than the manga.

314.title: Shirokuma Cafe
314.notes: The anime is good. Putri and I found this in a very round-about way but it's good.

318.title: Smoke Gets In Your Eyes
318.notes: I heard the audiobook after watching Doughty's YouTube.

320.title: Solanin
320.notes: Read this because of AKFG's song with the same name. It got me into Asano Inio's works.

321.title: Souso no Frieren
321.notes: Arguably one of the best things that came out of 2020. This series took the whole fantasy world party defeating the evil king and stuff, but make it so melancholic and refreshing. It's actually a sad story, but also hopeful at the same time. It feels a bit like a sunny day in winter. Abe Tsukasa's art also portrays the story well. I look forward to every Wednesday, when a new chapter is usually scanlated.

323.title: Stargirl
323.notes: The first book I read in TAISM.

331.title: Tamen de Gushi
331.notes: I found this when Hattchan told me about 19 Days. I like 19 Days more though, and that also gets more updates. But this is also cute, and also GL instead of BL.

332.title: Tangled Threads- A Hmong Girl's Story

335.title: Tengoku no Honya
335.notes: I saw this on the front page of MangaDex. Story is quite nice, maybe I should watch the movie?

336.title: Tenju no Kuni
336.notes: I bought 2 volumes of this legall!

341.title: The Book of Yokai- Mysterious Creatures of Japanese Folklore

342.title: The Buried Giant
342.notes: Vitaly saw a recommendation for this in the news and got it to read over Christmas. I borrowed it from him and enjoyed it. We sent Hattchan a copy some years after.

343.title: The Color of Earth
343.notes: I borrowed this from TAISM library.

344.title: The Devil is a Handsome Man
344.notes: Webtoon seems to have dropped the series with weird reasons despite the artist submitting the new chapters. What a shame, the series is so interesting (

346.title: The Fever King
346.notes: It’s a bit meh. I don’t like webtoon adaptations of young adult novels. I only read it because of the artist 😕 <br>The main ship feels forced, and barely any chemistry. The story feels convoluted and unclear - perhaps due to miscommunication between artist and author. I’m glad it is over.

349.title: The Girl Living Alone
349.notes: The first volume was available for free as a kindle ebook

351.title: The Great Passage
351.notes: I found this from Kindle. The anime is not bad, but the book is good. I didn't think I'd enjoy a book about dictionaries.

352.title: The Handmaid's Tale
352.notes: I thought this was a historical mstery novel, not a dystopian... But I finoshed it anyways, it's OK.

355.title: The Little Princess and the Forest Spirit
355.notes: The story is cute, but I somehow didn't like it as much as the other two series. It's quite interesting to see the portrayal of Vietnamese culture though. The fantasy element is less interesting to me.

358.title: The Mermaid Princess's Guilty Meal
358.notes: I found this on MangaDex, and then dropped it because of the weird, repetitive comedy. The ecchi part is weird.

359.title: The Middle Passage
359.notes: Vitaly read this and I wanted to read it too. It's my first time reading a travelouge and it's quite nice. I also learn a little about the West Indies.

362.title: The Old Mand and the Sea
362.notes: Read in school. I was not feeling good while reading this, so I didn't have the best memories, but it was quite memorable and enjoyable nevertheless.

364.title: The Specific Heat Capacity of Love

365.title: The Story of My Life
365.notes: I had to find a non-fiction for a book report. Since I had no idea what to read, I just took the oldest-looking book from the TAISM library, so old it was starting to fall apart. I read about Helen Keller before, so this book was enjoyable to read. After my book report, the library got a newer edition of the book (1990)

366.title: The Strange Tale of Panorama Island

367.title: The Summer of Penguins
367.notes: This is surprisingly my least favorite of these 3 comics. While the story is interesting and the art beautiful, there comic and storytelling part of the art seem to be somewhat lacking. I didn't feel like I could easily understand the characters' feelings and worries. There isn't enough character development, the story felt flat as a comic.

372.title: The Wize Wize Beasts of the Wizarding Wizdoms
372.notes: I only read this because of [[Itagaki Paru#Beastars|Beaststars]]

374.title: Thermae Romae
374.notes: This comic is really enjoyable - I want to read more from this author!

376.title: Three Colored Earth
376.notes: Is Yuniarto's oneshot. I appreciate this being actually completed and also based on Flores.

384.title: Usotoki Rhetoric
384.notes: Recommended by Hattchan, this is such a good series I'm so happy I read this. The two main characters just fits so well together.

386.title: Vampire Knight Memories
386.notes: A sequel of [[Hino Matsuri#Vampire Knight]]. I quite enjoy it. It's quite weird to see Matsuri being flip-floppy about the main couple of the story, though (Yuki-Kaname or Yuki-Zero after all). Having the two being canon is probably just fanservice after all. Dropped because no one is scanlating and I don't like it enough to buy it.

388.title: Void
388.notes: This is the weird moment in which a comic I found on Nhentai is actually good

391.title: We Are Pharmacists
391.notes: Ceritanya lucu, dan juga cukup informativ tentang kegiatan mahasiswa/i D3

394.title: What Don't You Understand?
394.notes: I read this from Putri's Tapas account

395.title: What Happened to Me - a Testimony of an Uyghur Woman

396.title: What It's Like in Space
396.notes: The cover is pretty, so I wanted to read this. I found a copy while I was on my free trial Scrid subscription that was given out during the first COVID-19 lockdown in 2020.

397.title: When the Day Comes
397.notes: Reading this because of the artist.

398.title: Wira Delima
398.notes: Originally a oneshot in an anthology, this is now serialized on Webtoon Indonesia! Currently reading this, but I liked [[Qoni#We Are Pharmacists]] more so far.

399.title: Witches
399.notes: This gives off the same vibe as feminist Korean webtoons in the 2014s+. So South Korea is 10 years behind Japan?

408.title: Yoru no Taiko
408.notes: I wanted to read more of Yamakawa's work after Coffee Mou Ippai

409.title: Yoshi no Zui Kara
409.notes: Seems like the series was cancelled, seeing that it ended with just 3 volumes. I do think Satsuki is good at slice-of-life genre, but her defiing work is still Barakamon after all... I hope she comes up with more entertaining series in the future! I bought the Yen Press edition of the last volume of this series, which was to be regretted because I bought it overpriced in Malmoe, Sweden.

410.title: Yumi's Cells
410.notes: One of my favorites on Webtoon. I'm so sad it ended. I've always looked forward to the weekday a new chapter would come out

411.title: Yuunagi no Machi Sakura no Kuni

412.title: Zikora
412.notes: I read this as this was a short story I could read for free with whatever subscribition I had on Amazon.indle

413.title: Zona Maya
413.notes: The ending felt a bit meh somehow. Everyone just kinda moved on with their life, separately. Though I suppose that's kinda realistic too. But something about the built-up to the climax in the end was a bit anti-climactic. I think the story is fine, but the execution is a bit meh.

424.title: Sousou no Frieren Anthology
424.authors: Kassan, Igarashi Souichi,Jona (城奈), Miura Ren, Yamaguchi Kazumi

425.title: Delicious in Dungeon
425.notes: This is so good, why did I not trust my insticts and read this right when it came out. And that it's the same person who did Terrarium in Drawer, goodness. I should've known, the comedic style is similar. The art and vibe are so different though.

429.title: The Secret of Angel (True Beauty) - Kisah Asli Drama

433.title: (Genshin Impact dj) Voices in Ice & Snow

442.title: A Space for the Unbound: Broken Memories

443.title: I Gave Birth to the Tyrant's Child

452.title: "A Fraction of Time" by Lisa Frühbeis

461.title: A Story About a Girl Eating Ice Cream

465.title: Genshin Comic Anthology (DNA Media Comics)
465.authors: Aku あく / azuma kohji 東 皓司 / amami yayuki 雨宮結生 / gyouza nuko 餃子ぬこ / / Kyo zip 狂zip / kurono yuu 黒野ユウ / koyukomu コユコム　/ sofura そふら　/ / Takahara yu 高原 由 / hattori masaki はっとりまさき　/ manarou まなろう/ inui ゐぬゐ,-cover illustration / Arutera あるてら

466.title: Maiden ~the tale of a prostitute taken in by a former knight~

478.title: Genshin Impact Comic Anthology

483.title: Kiyo in Kyoto: From the Maiko House

494.title: Remake・Relife 30-sai ni Naru to Jiyuu ni Seibetsu to Karada wo Tsukurinaoseru Sekai no Hanashi

495.title: Love Me for Who I Am

501.title: Pharaoh no Choai wa Mayonaka ni

508.title: The Story of the Wolf Who Picked up Little Red Riding Hood

512.title: Precious. 4P Short Stories
512.authors: Itoyoshi Ryouichi, Rasupe, Oohara Roron, Akitaka, Rucchiifu, Namori, Nakahara Kaihei, Yoneda Kazusa, Fujichika Koume, Konbu Wakame, Ikuhana Niiro, Yanagida Fumita, Yuzuchiri, Wakai Ken, Mizu Asato, Kaze no Ko, REI.,Niichi, Azuma Fuyu, Shiro Manta, Sorato Shunsuke, Kudo Makoto, Kinoue Seiichi, Arita Imari, Takaki Tsuyoshi

516.title: Ishi ni Usubeni, Tetsu ni Hoshi

518.title: I'm Gonna Fix that Girl (Emergence Alternate Ending)

521.title: Can You Fall in Love With the Skeleton?

526.title: Tamen De Gushi
526.authors: Tan jiu,Tan jiu / Tamen de gushi 202

528.title: 4 page de Owaru Rabukome Shiki Jinsei

530.title: At 30, I Realized I Had No Gender

531.title: Seibetsu X
531.notes: One of the first comics I read about being nonbinary, which is called x-gender in Japan. It's quite interesting, and surprisingly relatable.

534.title: I Want to Be a Wall «Official»

539.title: Honkai: Star Rail - 泡沫の夢

541.title: Honkai Star Rail: A Cheesey One-Liner

542.title: BL Metamorphosis
542.notes: Somehow reminds me of Hattchan and makes me want to draw my own comics. There's a movie based on this that I watched with both Hattchan and Paul~

544.title: Genshin Impact - Journey With A Gentle Breeze

548.title: Genshin Impact - Teyvat Slice of Life (Xinzoruo)

549.title: Genshin Impact - Modern Slice of Life (Xinzoruo)

550.title: Madame Petite
550.notes: This was surprisingly modern - I didn't expect that consiering the setting, but makes sense considering the publication year. I was really impressed by the fact that the main male lead is a brown guy.

552.title: That's My Atypical Girl
552.notes: Basically a romance between an autistic girl who is very much depressed and needs help. Quite interesting but also a bit dark, sad, and bleak. Interesting to read, but also kinda scary.

553.title: Nikagetsugo ni Seibetsu ga Bareru Josou Danshi

558.title: Seven Little Sons of the Dragon: A Collection of Seven Stories

560.title: The Blue Eye of Horus: The Story of a Queen Dressed as a Man

561.title: Hiiragi-senpai to Ofutari-sama
561.notes: I'm only reading this because it's by Mizuno Minami and I really liked Rainbow Days. This doesn't hit quite as hard though.

562.title: The Girl I Was Interested in Was a Two-Mouthed Youkai

563.title: The Autism Spectrum Guide to Sexuality and Relationships

564.title: Saha
564.notes: I wanted to listen to this story after Cho Nam-Joo's Kim Ji Young that Vitaly got for Hattchan.

565.title: Hello, Friends!
565.notes: I like Dulce and I only read this to kinda support her new book

568.title: Circe
568.notes: I listened to this because Hattchan recommended this to me. It was indeed interesting

572.title: What You Are Looking For Is in the Library
572.notes: A light novel series that goes into that cute bookshop cozy vibes kind of story.

575.title: Homebody
575.notes: This was recomended to me as a graphic novel that focuses on nonbinary experience.

577.title: Shubeik Lubeik
577.notes: I saw this on twitter from Reimena Yee. It's really good and talks about depression.

580.title: Like Two Peas in a Pod

586.title: Lunar Boy
586.notes: A trans story written and drawn by twins Indonesian diaspora  (to the US, presumably). Realy cool!

587.title: Bohemian Rhapsody
587.notes: I watched this at Uni-Kino with Seida! I didn't know how gay and immigrant Freddie Mercury was. It was a cool movie.

588.title: The Ties
588.notes: 4/5. This was part of the 37th Filmtage des Mittelmeers in Heidelberg. I watched this with Seida. The ending of this movie is very satisfying with the kids releasing their trauma of growing up with both of their parents having affairs.

589.title: Mediterranean Fever
589.notes: 5/5. This was part of the 37th Filmtage des Mittelmeers in Heidelberg, I watched this with Seida. This was my favorite movie from this year! Funny, thought-provoking, and a little dark.

590.title: Return to Seoul
590.notes: 3/5. The movie depicts the trauma of adoption, perhaps. The protragonist always returns to her birth country, despite things always going bad for her there. It's a sad and avant-garde movie. It has to be said, the lead actress was impressive, despite having never acted before.

591.title: The Albanian Virgin
591.notes: 5/5. Seida took me to watch this movie. It's impressive that  a seemingly conservative society still had space for transgender identities. I think it's not quite the LGBT story the West would like, it's very uniquely Albanian. It's nice to hear Seida's commentary about how northern the accent that they spoke in was.

592.title: Suzume
592.notes: I watched this with Jenny. It's an OK movie.

593.title: Josee, the Tiger and the Fish
593.notes: I've always wanted to watch this eversince I heard the music from Eve, like Shinkai. I watched this with Paul and it was quite a nice movie.

594.title: You're Dead To Me
594.notes: My favorite history podcast. I like the concept, and it's both entertaining and informative.

595.title: In This Corner of the World
595.notes: I watched this at Putri's house with Vitaly. It's sad and a lot of people died, but I somehow found solace in the fact that life somehow moved on and the family supports each other during tough times.

596.title: The Untamed
596.notes: I watched this with Hattchan last I visited Oman in December 2022.

597.title: Nirvana in Fire
597.notes: I started watching this with my parents before COVID, and then continued watching this with Vitaly during COVID. I really got into this series and watched the whole series twice, it feels like. I want to read the book. I never finished watching the sequel, though.
